snippet: Phil Hughes pitched perhaps his best game of the season, and the Yankees erupted with three home runs, including a grand slam by Robinson Cano.
abstract: New York Yankees defeat Kansas City Royals, 10-4; Yankees pitcher Phil Hughes produces perhaps his best game of the season, and the Yankees back him up with three home runs. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: KANSAS CITY, Mo. -- After a particularly dispiriting loss Saturday night, Alex Rodriguez set out the core expectations that he and his teammates in the middle of the batting order hold sacred: damage, production, wins. In a game the Yankees felt they had to win, they followed that formula rigorously and came away with a 10-4 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Sunday to salvage a split in a series that was a disaster even before the first game was played.

headline.main: Hughes and Offense Allow Yankees to Exit Kansas City on an Up Note
